required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serial Ultrasound in Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma (mRCC)
clinical_study.official_title: Early Therapeutic Monitoring of Response to Therapy With Serial Ultrasound in Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma (mRCC)

brief_summary.textblock: To assess whether changes in quantitative tumor perfusion parameters after 3 weeks of treatment, as measured by power doppler ultrasound, can predict initial objective response, defined by current standard-of-care, to therapy at 12 weeks after start of treatment

primary_outcome.description: Initial objective response is defined as having either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) per RECIST v1.1 at first on-treatment response evaluation 8-16 weeks after initiating treatment. The results will be expressed as number without dispersion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in tumor burden compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change will be assessed as sum of all tumor diameters between treatment 'baseline' and first on-treatment response evaluation 8-16 weeks after start of treatment, using RECIST v1.1 for tumor diameter measurements, expressed as mean +/- standard deviation and median with interquartile range

Relative change in tumor diameter of a single lesion between treatment 'baseline' and first on-treatment response evaluation 8-16 weeks after start of treatment, using RECIST v1.1 for tumor diameter measurements, will be measured as mean +/- standard deviation and median with interquartile range.

PFS is defined as not having experienced any progressive disease (PD) per RECIST v1.1 within the first 12 months after initiating treatment (day 1 will be treatment start date), as a number and proportion without dispersion.

arm_group.description: Patients receiving standard of care anti-angiogenesis inhibitor plus immune checkpoint inhibitor will have power doppler imaging at baseline, 3 weeks and 6 weeks.

intervention.description: Power doppler measurements will be made
Vantage 256 with C5-2v transducer, used for power doppler ultrasound, manufactured by Verasonics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pathology-confirmed diagnosis of metastatic RCC
- At least one tumor lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter, amenable to ultrasound imaging
- Planned to be treated with VEGFR2 tyrosine kinase inhibitor plus immune checkpoint inhibitor
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
Any comorbid condition that, in the opinion of the treating provider or the Protocol Directors, compromises the participant's ability to participate in the study.
